message_1: Consider a temporal logic statement "At every even second in time, the proposition P is true". If P is true at time 0 (i.e., P(0) is true), is P true at time 6?
message_2:
Yes, P is true at time 6.

Since the given temporal logic statement says that "At every even second in time, the proposition P is true", we can deduce that P is true at all even time instances. Time 6 is an even number (as it is divisible by 2), so according to the statement, P is true at time 6.
